findings.title: Encourages Dangerous Auto-Approval Flags Without Adequate Warning
findings.description: The skill explicitly instructs users to enable dangerous auto-approval flags (--full-auto for Codex, --dangerously-skip-permissions for Claude Code) that bypass security confirmations. While it asks 'explicitly', there is no prominent warning about the security implications of disabling permission checks in automated loops that execute arbitrary code.
findings.snippet:
Auto‑approve flags (ask explicitly)
  - Codex: `--full-auto`
  - Claude Code: `--dangerously-skip-permissions`
findings.remediation: Add explicit security warnings about the risks of auto-approval flags. Recommend users review what commands will be executed before enabling these flags. Consider suggesting safer alternatives like limited approval scopes or requiring manual review for sensitive operations.

metadata.overall_assessment: MODERATE RISK - This skill generates bash scripts for automated AI coding loops. Primary concerns: (1) Encourages dangerous auto-approval flags without adequate security warnings, (2) Potential for unbounded loop execution and resource exhaustion, (3) Incomplete instructions that could lead to malformed script generation. The skill itself does not contain malicious code or data exfiltration, but the automation patterns it promotes (auto-approval + loops + code execution) create security risks if users don't understand the implications. The truncated instruction body is also concerning as it may generate incomplete scripts.
metadata.meta_confidence_reason: The skill explicitly instructs collection of dangerous flags, and while safety guidance exists, it's separated from the flag configuration by several sections. The LLM analyzer correctly identified this as a tool exploitation risk. The actual SKILL.md content confirms the warning placement issue.
metadata.meta_exploitability: Medium - Requires user to follow instructions and enable auto-approval, but the skill's design encourages this configuration
metadata.meta_impact: High - Auto-approved loops can execute arbitrary code, modify files, and make network requests without human oversight

findings.title: Unbounded Loop Execution Risk
findings.description: The skill generates bash scripts that run AI coding CLIs in loops with only optional completion conditions. While max iterations are mentioned, the implementation details are incomplete (instruction body cuts off). Without proper safeguards, loops could run indefinitely consuming resources, especially if completion conditions fail or are misconfigured.
findings.snippet: The loop persists context via `PROMPT.md` + `AGENTS.md` (loaded every iteration)... Max iterations... Build the per‑iteration command [instruction cuts off]
findings.remediation: Ensure generated scripts include: (1) Mandatory max iteration limits with reasonable defaults, (2) Timeout mechanisms per iteration, (3) Resource monitoring and circuit breakers, (4) Clear error handling for failed completion conditions, (5) User confirmation before starting loops with high iteration counts.
